text: my passion for flying and wind power has
whoo it's in my childhood I always
wanted to fly like a bird when I started
skydiving I quickly realized but with my
size and my weight I was always fast
flying forward and in 2012 I set a first
world record 304 kilometres per hour in
ground speed without any tailwind
as a next step I wanted to find out how
fast I could fly with a good tailwind
and the best option of course was the
jet stream the jet streams are really
strong winds at levels of about 7,000 to
12,000 meters they run around the globe
and they are really the strongest winds
we can find in Switzerland we have
startups they are building kites they go
up to high altitude levels and they
bring the power down and produce
electricity
this ignited the idea for me to take
this jet stream to accelerate my own
free form the goal was to go as high as
possible because the higher you go the
higher speeds you get humans are not
made for high altitudes like that and of
course I needed special training and
special equipment
between June and July 2018 we were so
lucky to find theif Griffin our balloon
pilots and high altitude record holder
here in Australia he was the key person
to bring us up in the end after takeoff
everything went fine we had a beautiful
sunrise but 30 minutes later at 7,000
meters the problems started suddenly we
had this leaking problem of the oxygen
we could deal with that we knew it
before from the training but at the same
time we had the problem of this burners
and the flame disappeared and the
combination of these two problems put a
lot of stress in the situation easily
good guy I knew I had I had to leave but
I could not concentrate on my first task
the speed anymore
my own oxygen system worked absolutely
fantastic and I could rely on that but
at the same time I was worried about my
two friends in the balloon because they
were in great danger after my landing I
was searching for the balloon and I had
about 15 minutes on the ground I was
desperate I didn't care about any record
and then the relief came it was a phone
call of Steve Griffin and he told me
everything went fine welcome back to a
great experience
man so the whole adventure didn't go
100% according to plan and the question
was it worthwhile it's hard to tell now
when everyone is safe in one piece on
the ground I would say yes of course but
we were really lucky
[Music]
